content.question: If <math alttext="e raised to the 2 y power, minus e raised to the open parenthesis, y squared, minus y, close parenthesis, power, equals x to the fourth power, minus, x squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, then the value of <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at the point <math alttext="with coordinates 1 comma 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
